         </a>

      <p>
       <b>
        Hungary
       </b>
       (
       <span class="nowrap">
        <span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt">
         <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">
          /
          <span style="border-bottom:1px dotted">
           <span title="/ˈ/: primary stress follows">
            ˈ
           </span>
           <span title="'h' in 'hi'">
            h
           </span>
           <span title="/ʌ/: 'u' in 'cut'">
            ʌ
           </span>
           <span title="/ŋ/: 'ng' in 'sing'">
            ŋ
           </span>
           <span title="/ɡ/: 'g' in 'guy'">
            ɡ
           </span>
           <span title="/ər/: 'er' in 'letter'">
            ər
           </span>
           <span title="/i/: 'y' in 'happy'">
            i
           </span>
          </span>
          /
         </a>
        </span>
        <small class="nowrap">
         (
         <span class="unicode haudio">
          <span class="fn">
           <span style="white-space:nowrap">
            <a href="/wiki/File:En-us-Hungary.ogg" title="About this sound">
             <img alt="About this sound" data-file-height="20" data-file-width="20" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" width="11"/>
            </a>
           </span>
           <a class="internal" href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/96/En-us-Hungary.ogg" title="En-us-Hungary.ogg">
            listen
           </a>
          </span>
         </span>
         )
        </small>
       </span>
       ;
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_language" title="Hungarian language">
        Hungarian
       </a>
       :
       <i>
        <span lang="hu">
         Magyarország
        </span>
       </i>
       <span class="IPA" title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)">
        <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Hungarian" title="Help:IPA/Hungarian">
         [ˈmɒɟɒrorsaːɡ]
        </a>
       </span>
       <small class="nowrap">
        (
        <span class="unicode haudio">
         <span class="fn">
          <span style="white-space:nowrap">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Hu-Magyarorsz%C3%A1g.ogg" title="About this sound">
            <img alt="About this sound" data-file-height="20" data-file-width="20" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" width="11"/>
           </a>
          </span>
          <a class="internal" href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/20/Hu-Magyarorsz%C3%A1g.ogg" title="Hu-Magyarország.ogg">
           listen
          </a>
         </span>
        </span>
        )
       </small>
       ) is a landlocked country in
       <a href="/wiki/Central_Europe" title="Central Europe">
        Central Europe
       </a>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Flaw_2-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-Flaw-2">
         [2]
        </a>
       </sup>
       which covers an area of 93,030 square kilometres (35,920 sq mi) in the
       <a href="/wiki/Pannonian_Basin" title="Pannonian Basin">
        Carpathian Basin
       </a>
       , bordered by
       <a href="/wiki/Slovakia" title="Slovakia">
        Slovakia
       </a>
       to the north,
       <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">
        Romania
       </a>
       to the east,
       <a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">
        Serbia
       </a>
       to the south,
       <a href="/wiki/Croatia" title="Croatia">
        Croatia
       </a>
       to the southwest,
       <a href="/wiki/Slovenia" title="Slovenia">
        Slovenia
       </a>
       to the west,
       <a href="/wiki/Austria" title="Austria">
        Austria
       </a>
       to the northwest, and
       <a href="/wiki/Ukraine" title="Ukraine">
        Ukraine
       </a>
       to the northeast.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12">
        <a href="#cite_note-12">
         [12]
        </a>
       </sup>
       With about 10 million inhabitants, Hungary is a
       <a href="/wiki/Member_state_of_the_European_Union" title="Member state of the European Union">
        medium-sized member state
       </a>
       of the
       <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">
        European Union
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13">
        <a href="#cite_note-13">
         [13]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Hungary" title="Languages of Hungary">
        official language
       </a>
       is
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_language" title="Hungarian language">
        Hungarian
       </a>
       , which is the most widely spoken
       <a href="/wiki/Uralic_languages" title="Uralic languages">
        Uralic language
       </a>
       in the world.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14">
        <a href="#cite_note-14">
         [14]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Hungary's capital and its
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_and_towns_of_Hungary" title="List of cities and towns of Hungary">
        largest city and metropolis
       </a>
       is
       <a href="/wiki/Budapest" title="Budapest">
        Budapest
       </a>
       , a significant economic hub, classified as a leading
       <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">
        global city
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15">
        <a href="#cite_note-15">
         [15]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Major urban areas include
       <a href="/wiki/Debrecen" title="Debrecen">
        Debrecen
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Szeged" title="Szeged">
        Szeged
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Miskolc" title="Miskolc">
        Miskolc
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/P%C3%A9cs" title="Pécs">
        Pécs
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Gy%C5%91r" title="Győr">
        Győr
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       Following centuries of successive habitation by
       <a href="/wiki/Celts" title="Celts">
        Celts
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Ancient_Rome" title="Ancient Rome">
        Romans
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/West_Slavs" title="West Slavs">
        West Slavs
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Gepids" title="Gepids">
        Gepids
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Avars_(Carpathians)" title="Avars (Carpathians)">
        Avars
       </a>
       , the foundation of Hungary was laid in the late 9th century by the
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarians" title="Hungarians">
        Hungarian
       </a>
       grand prince
       <a href="/wiki/%C3%81rp%C3%A1d" title="Árpád">
        Árpád
       </a>
       in the
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_conquest_of_the_Carpathian_Basin" title="Hungarian conquest of the Carpathian Basin">
        conquest of the Carpathian Basin
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-16">
        <a href="#cite_note-16">
         [16]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Acta_orientalia_Academiae_Scientiarum_Hungaricae_17-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Acta_orientalia_Academiae_Scientiarum_Hungaricae-17">
         [17]
        </a>
       </sup>
       His great-grandson
       <a href="/wiki/Stephen_I_of_Hungary" title="Stephen I of Hungary">
        Stephen I
       </a>
       ascended the throne in 1000, converting the country to a
       <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Hungary" title="Kingdom of Hungary">
        Christian kingdom
       </a>
       . By the 12th century, Hungary became a middle power within the Western world, reaching a
       <a href="/wiki/History_of_Hungary#Age_of_early_absolutism" title="History of Hungary">
        golden age by the 15th century
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-18">
        <a href="#cite_note-18">
         [18]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Following the
       <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Moh%C3%A1cs" title="Battle of Mohács">
        Battle of Mohács
       </a>
       in 1526 and about 150 years of partial
       <a href="/wiki/Ottoman_Hungary" title="Ottoman Hungary">
        Ottoman occupation
       </a>
       (1541–1699), Hungary came under
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Habsburg_Empire" title="Habsburg Empire">
        Habsburg rule
       </a>
       , and later formed the
       <a href="/wiki/Great_power" title="Great power">
        great power
       </a>
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Austro%E2%80%93Hungarian_Empire" title="Austro–Hungarian Empire">
        Austro–Hungarian Empire
       </a>
       together with
       <a href="/wiki/Austrian_Empire" title="Austrian Empire">
        Austria
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-19">
        <a href="#cite_note-19">
         [19]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Hungary's current borders were established in 1920 by the
       <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Trianon" title="Treaty of Trianon">
        Treaty of Trianon
       </a>
       after
       <a href="/wiki/World_War_I" title="World War I">
        World War I
       </a>
       , when the country lost 71% of its territory, 58% of its population, and
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_diaspora" title="Hungarian diaspora">
        32% of ethnic Hungarians
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-20">
        <a href="#cite_note-20">
         [20]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-21">
        <a href="#cite_note-21">
         [21]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22">
        <a href="#cite_note-22">
         [22]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Following the
       <a href="/wiki/Hungary_between_the_World_Wars" title="Hungary between the World Wars">
        interwar period
       </a>
       , Hungary joined the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Axis_Powers" title="Axis Powers">
        Axis Powers
       </a>
       in
       <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">
        World War II
       </a>
       , suffering significant damage and casualties.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Montgomery_23-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Montgomery-23">
         [23]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Thomas,_pg._11_24-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Thomas,_pg._11-24">
         [24]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Hungary became a satellite state of the
       <a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">
        Soviet Union
       </a>
       , which contributed to the establishment of a
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_People%27s_Republic" title="Hungarian People's Republic">
        socialist republic spanning four decades
       </a>
       (1947–1989).
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Rao,_B._V._2006_25-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Rao,_B._V._2006-25">
         [25]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The country gained widespread international attention regarding the
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Revolution_of_1956" title="Hungarian Revolution of 1956">
        Revolution of 1956
       </a>
       and the seminal
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/End_of_Communism_in_Hungary_(1989)#Attitudes_toward_the_Warsaw_Pact" title="End of Communism in Hungary (1989)">
        opening of its previously-restricted border with Austria in 1989
       </a>
       , which accelerated the collapse of the
       <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Bloc" title="Eastern Bloc">
        Eastern Bloc
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-26">
        <a href="#cite_note-26">
         [26]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-27">
        <a href="#cite_note-27">
         [27]
        </a>
       </sup>
       On 23 October 1989, Hungary again became a
       <a href="/wiki/Democracy" title="Democracy">
        democratic
       </a>
       <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_republic" title="Parliamentary republic">
        parliamentary republic
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28">
        <a href="#cite_note-28">
         [28]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       In the 21st century, Hungary is a
       <a href="/wiki/Middle_power" title="Middle power">
        middle power
       </a>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Solomon_29-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Solomon-29">
         [29]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Higott-Cooper_30-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Higott-Cooper-30">
         [30]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and has the world's
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal)">
        57th largest economy by nominal GDP
       </a>
       , as well as the
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(PPP)" title="List of countries by GDP (PPP)">
        58th largest by PPP
       </a>
       , out of 191 countries measured by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/IMF" title="IMF">
        IMF
       </a>
       . As a substantial actor in several industrial and technological sectors,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-31">
        <a href="#cite_note-31">
         [31]
        </a>
       </sup>
       it is the world's
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_exports" title="List of countries by exports">
        35th largest exporter
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_imports" title="List of countries by imports">
        34th largest importer
       </a>
       of goods. Hungary is an
       <a href="/wiki/OECD" title="OECD">
        OECD
       </a>
       <a href="/wiki/World_Bank_high-income_economy" title="World Bank high-income economy">
        high-income economy
       </a>
       with a
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Human_Development_Index" title="List of countries by Human Development Index">
        very high standard of living
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-wb_32-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-wb-32">
         [32]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33">
        <a href="#cite_note-33">
         [33]
        </a>
       </sup>
       It keeps up a
       <a href="/wiki/Social_security" title="Social security">
        social security
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Healthcare_in_Hungary" title="Healthcare in Hungary">
        universal health care
       </a>
       system, and a tuition-free
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_universities_in_Hungary" title="List of universities in Hungary">
        university education
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-auto_34-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-auto-34">
         [34]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-auto1_35-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-auto1-35">
         [35]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Hungary performs well in
       <a href="/wiki/International_rankings_of_Hungary" title="International rankings of Hungary">
        international rankings
       </a>
       : it is 20th in
       <a href="/wiki/Quality_of_life" title="Quality of life">
        quality of life
       </a>
       , 24th in
       <a href="/wiki/Good_Country_Index" title="Good Country Index">
        Good Country Index
       </a>
       , 28th in
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_inequality-adjusted_HDI" title="List of countries by inequality-adjusted HDI">
        inequality-adjusted human development
       </a>
       , 32nd in the
       <a href="/wiki/Social_Progress_Index" title="Social Progress Index">
        Social Progress Index
       </a>
       , 33rd in
       <a href="/wiki/Global_Innovation_Index" title="Global Innovation Index">
        Global Innovation Index
       </a>
       and ranks as the
       <a href="/wiki/Global_Peace_Index" title="Global Peace Index">
        15th safest country
       </a>
       in the world.
      </p>
      <p>
       Hungary joined the
       <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">
        European Union
       </a>
       in 2004 and has been part of the
       <a href="/wiki/Schengen_Area" title="Schengen Area">
        Schengen Area
       </a>
       since 2007.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-36">
        <a href="#cite_note-36">
         [36]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Hungary is a member of the
       <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">
        United Nations
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">
        NATO
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/WTO" title="WTO">
        WTO
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">
        World Bank
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Asian_Infrastructure_Investment_Bank" title="Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank">
        AIIB
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Europe" title="Council of Europe">
        Council of Europe
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Visegr%C3%A1d_Group" title="Visegrád Group">
        Visegrád Group
       </a>
       and more.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-37">
        <a href="#cite_note-37">
         [37]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Well known for its rich
       <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_Hungary" title="Culture of Hungary">
        cultural
       </a>
       history, Hungary has contributed significantly to
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_art" title="Hungarian art">
        arts
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Music_of_Hungary" title="Music of Hungary">
        music
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_literature" title="Hungarian literature">
        literature
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Hungary_at_the_Olympics" title="Hungary at the Olympics">
        sports
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_Hungary" title="Science and technology in Hungary">
        science and technology
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-38">
        <a href="#cite_note-38">
         [38]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-39">
        <a href="#cite_note-39">
         [39]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Britannic._40-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Britannic.-40">
         [40]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-41">
        <a href="#cite_note-41">
         [41]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Hungary is the
       <a href="/wiki/World_Tourism_rankings" title="World Tourism rankings">
        11th most popular
       </a>
       country as a
       <a href="/wiki/Tourism_in_Hungary" title="Tourism in Hungary">
        tourist destination
       </a>
       in Europe, attracting 14.3 million international tourists in 2015.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-WTO_Tourism_Highlights_2016_Edition_42-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-WTO_Tourism_Highlights_2016_Edition-42">
         [42]
        </a>
       </sup>
       It is home to the largest
       <a href="/wiki/Hot_spring" title="Hot spring">
        thermal water
       </a>
       cave system and the
       <a href="/wiki/Lake_H%C3%A9v%C3%ADz" title="Lake Hévíz">
        second largest thermal lake
       </a>
       in the world, the
       <a href="/wiki/Lake_Balaton" title="Lake Balaton">
        largest lake in Central Europe
       </a>
       and the
       <a href="/wiki/Hortob%C3%A1gy_National_Park" title="Hortobágy National Park">
        largest natural grasslands in Europe
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-43">
        <a href="#cite_note-43">
         [43]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-44">
        <a href="#cite_note-44">
         [44]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <div class="toclimit-3">
       <div class="toc" id="toc">

             </span>

             </span>

             </span>

             <span class="tocnumber">

             </span>

             </span>
            </a>
            <ul>

             </span>

           </span>

           </span>
          </a>
          <ul>

             </span>

             </span>

              Transport
             </span>
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
         </li>
         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-26">
          <a href="#Demographics">
           <span class="tocnumber">
            6
           </span>
           <span class="toctext">
            Demographics
           </span>
          </a>
          <ul>
           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-27">

             </span>
             <span class="toctext">
              Languages
             </span>

           </li>

             </span>
             <span class="toctext">
              Religion
             </span>
            </a>
           </li>
           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-29">
            <a href="#Education">
             <span class="tocnumber">
              6.3
             </span>
             <span class="toctext">
              Education
             </span>
            </a>
           </li>
           <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-30">
            <a href="#Health">
             <span class="tocnumber">
              6.4
             </span>
             <span class="toctext">
              Health
             </span>
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
         </li>
         <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-31">
          <a href="#Culture">
           <span class="tocnumber">
            7
           </span>

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Etymology">
        Etymology
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hungary&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Etymology">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Name_of_Hungary" title="Name of Hungary">
        Name of Hungary
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       The "H" in the name of Hungary (and Latin
       <i>
        Hungaria
       </i>
       ) is most likely due to early ill-founded historical associations with the
       <a href="/wiki/Huns" title="Huns">
        Huns
       </a>
       , who had settled Hungary prior to the
       <a href="/wiki/Pannonian_Avars" title="Pannonian Avars">
        Avars
       </a>
       . The rest of the word comes from the Latinized form of
       <a href="/wiki/Medieval_Greek" title="Medieval Greek">
        Medieval Greek
       </a>
       <i>
        Oungroi
       </i>
       (Οὔγγροι). According to an explanation the Greek name was borrowed from
       <a href="/wiki/Proto-Slavic" title="Proto-Slavic">
        Proto-Slavic
       </a>
       <i>
        Ǫgǔri
       </i>
       (Ѫгъри), in turn borrowed from
       <a href="/wiki/Oghur_languages" title="Oghur languages">
        Oghur-Turkic
       </a>
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Onogurs" title="Onogurs">
         Onogur
        </a>
       </i>
       ('ten [tribes of the]
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ogur" title="Ogur">
        Ogurs
       </a>
       ').
       <i>
        Onogur
       </i>
       was the collective name for the tribes who later joined the
       <a href="/wiki/Bulgars" title="Bulgars">
        Bulgar
       </a>
       tribal confederacy that ruled the eastern parts of Hungary after the Avars.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Király_45-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Király-45">
         [45]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-46">
        <a href="#cite_note-46">
         [46]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The Hungarian
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Endonym" title="Endonym">
        endonym
       </a>
       is
       <i>
        Magyarország
       </i>
       , composed of
       <i>
        magyar
       </i>
       ('Hungarian') and
       <i>
        ország
       </i>
       ('country'). The word
       <i>
        magyar
       </i>
       is taken from the name of one of the seven major semi-nomadic Hungarian tribes,
       <i>
        magyeri
       </i>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-47">
        <a href="#cite_note-47">
         [47]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-48">
        <a href="#cite_note-48">
         [48]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-49">
        <a href="#cite_note-49">
         [49]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The first element
       <i>
        magy
       </i>
       is likely from
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Proto-Ugric" title="Proto-Ugric">
        Proto-Ugric
       </a>
       *
       <i>
        mäńć-
       </i>
       'man, person', also found in the name of the
       <a href="/wiki/Mansi_people" title="Mansi people">
        Mansi people
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        mäńćī, mańśi, måńś
       </i>
       ). The second element
       <i>
        eri
       </i>
       , 'man, men, lineage', survives in Hungarian
       <i>
        férj
       </i>
       'husband', and is cognate with
       <a href="/wiki/Mari_language" title="Mari language">
        Mari
       </a>
       <i>
        erge
       </i>
       'son',
       <a href="/wiki/Finnish_language" title="Finnish language">
        Finnish
       </a>
       archaic
       <i>
        yrkä
       </i>
       'young man'.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-50">
        <a href="#cite_note-50">
         [50]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <table class="wikitable" style="float:center; clear:right;">
       <caption>
        Official names

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="History">
        History
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hungary&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: History">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/History_of_Hungary" title="History of Hungary">
        History of Hungary

             </td>
            </tr>
            <tr style="vertical-align:top">
             <td style="text-align:left;">
              <a href="/wiki/Hungary_in_World_War_II" title="Hungary in World War II">
               World War II
              </a>
             </td>
             <td style="text-align:right;">
              1941–1945
             </td>
            </tr>
           </table>
          </div>
         </div>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="padding:0 0.1em 0.4em">
         <div class="NavFrame collapsed" style="border:none;padding:0">
          <div class="NavHead" style="font-size:105%;background:transparent;text-align:left;background: #eee">
           Contemporary
          </div>
          <div class="NavContent" style="font-size:105%;padding:0.2em 0 0.4em;text-align:center">
           <table style="width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0px 0px;border:none">
            <tr style="vertical-align:top">
             <td style="text-align:left;">
              <a href="/wiki/Second_Hungarian_Republic" title="Second Hungarian Republic">
               Second Hungarian Republic
              </a>
             </td>
             <td style="text-align:right;">
              1946–1949
             </td>
            </tr>
            <tr style="vertical-align:top">
             <td style="text-align:left;">
              <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_People%27s_Republic" title="Hungarian People's Republic">
               Hungarian People's Republic
              </a>
             </td>
             <td style="text-align:right;">
              1949–1989
             </td>
            </tr>
            <tr style="vertical-align:top">
             <td style="text-align:left;">
              <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Revolution_of_1956" title="Hungarian Revolution of 1956">
               Revolution of 1956
              </a>
             </td>
             <td style="text-align:right;">
              1956
             </td>
            </tr>
            <tr style="vertical-align:top">
             <td style="text-align:left;">
              <a href="/wiki/History_of_Hungary#Third_Republic_.281989-_.29" title="History of Hungary">
               Third Hungarian Republic
              </a>
             </td>
             <td style="text-align:right;">
              since 1989
             </td>
            </tr>
           </table>
          </div>
         </div>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="padding:0 0.1em 0.4em">

              </a>
             </li>
            </ul>
            <ul>
             <li>
              <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hungarian_people" title="Hungarian people">

              </a>
             </li>

       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td style="padding:0.3em 0.4em 0.3em;font-weight:bold;border-top: 1px solid #aaa; border-bottom: 1px solid #aaa;">
         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Hungary.svg">
          <img alt="Flag of Hungary.svg" class="noviewer" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1200" height="8" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/Flag_of_Hungary.svg/16px-Flag_of_Hungary.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/Flag_of_Hungary.svg/24px-Flag_of_Hungary.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c1/Flag_of_Hungary.svg/32px-Flag_of_Hungary.svg.png 2x" width="16"/>
         </a>

         </a>
        </td>
       </tr>

        <td style="text-align:right;font-size:115%;padding-top: 0.6em;">
         <div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini">

             </abbr>
            </a>

            <a href="/wiki/Template_talk:History_of_Hungary" title="Template talk:History of Hungary">

             </abbr>
            </a>

            <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:History_of_Hungary&amp;action=edit">
