          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n_2016-02-17.jpg">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="412" data-file-width="315" height="170" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n_2016-02-17.jpg/130px-Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n_2016-02-17.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n_2016-02-17.jpg/195px-Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n_2016-02-17.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n_2016-02-17.jpg/260px-Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n_2016-02-17.jpg 2x" width="130"/>
          </a>
         </div>
         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left;text-align:center">
          <a href="/wiki/Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n" title="Viktor Orbán">
           Viktor Orbán
          </a>
          ,
          <br/>
          <small>
           <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Hungary" title="Prime Minister of Hungary">
            Prime Minister
           </a>
           since 2010
          </small>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div style="clear:left">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Hungary is a
       <a href="/wiki/Unitary_state" title="Unitary state">
        unitary
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Parliamentary_democratic" title="Parliamentary democratic">
        parliamentary
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Representative_democracy" title="Representative democracy">
        representative democratic
       </a>
       <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_republic" title="Parliamentary republic">
        republic
       </a>
       . The Hungarian political system operates under a framework reformed in 2012; this constitutional document is the
       <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Hungary" title="Constitution of Hungary">
        Fundamental Law of Hungary
       </a>
       . Amendments generally require a two-thirds majority of parliament; the fundamental principles of the constitution (as expressed in the articles guaranteeing human dignity, the separation of powers, the state structure, and the
       <a href="/wiki/Rule_of_law" title="Rule of law">
        rule of law
       </a>
       ) are valid in perpetuity. 199 Members of Parliament (
       <i>
        országgyűlési képviselő
       </i>
       ) are elected to the highest organ of state authority, the
       <a href="/wiki/Unicameralism" title="Unicameralism">
        unicameral
       </a>
       <i>
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/National_Assembly_of_Hungary" title="National Assembly of Hungary">
         Országgyűlés
        </a>
       </i>
       (National Assembly), every four years in a single-round
       <a href="/wiki/First-past-the-post_voting" title="First-past-the-post voting">
        first-past-the-post
       </a>
       election with an
       <a href="/wiki/Election_threshold" title="Election threshold">
        election threshold
       </a>
       of 5%.
      </p>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Hungary" title="Prime Minister of Hungary">
        Prime Minister
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        miniszterelnök
       </i>
       ) is elected by the National Assembly, serving as the
       <a href="/wiki/Head_of_government" title="Head of government">
        head of government
       </a>
       and exercising
       <a href="/wiki/Executive_(government)" title="Executive (government)">
        executive power
       </a>
       . Traditionally, the Prime Minister is the leader of the largest party in parliament. The Prime Minister selects
       <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Hungary" title="Government of Hungary">
        Cabinet
       </a>
       ministers and has the exclusive right to dismiss them, although cabinet nominees must appear before consultative open hearings before one or more parliamentary
       <a href="/wiki/Committee" title="Committee">
        committees
       </a>
       , survive a vote in the National Assembly, and be formally approved by the President. The cabinet reports to
       <a href="/wiki/National_Assembly_(Hungary)" title="National Assembly (Hungary)">
        parliament
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2945" data-file-width="4448" height="146" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg/220px-S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg/330px-S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg/440px-S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:S%C3%A1ndor-palota_naps%C3%BCt%C3%A9sben.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S%C3%A1ndor_Palace" title="Sándor Palace">
          Sándor Palace
         </a>
         is the
         <a href="/wiki/Official_residence" title="Official residence">
          official residence
         </a>
         of the
         <a href="/wiki/President_of_Hungary" title="President of Hungary">
          President of Hungary
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Parliament_Building,_Budapest,_outside.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="3520" data-file-width="5412" height="143" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Parliament_Building%2C_Budapest%2C_outside.jpg/220px-Parliament_Building%2C_Budapest%2C_outside.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Parliament_Building%2C_Budapest%2C_outside.jpg/330px-Parliament_Building%2C_Budapest%2C_outside.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Parliament_Building%2C_Budapest%2C_outside.jpg/440px-Parliament_Building%2C_Budapest%2C_outside.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Parliament_Building,_Budapest,_outside.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Parliament_Building" title="Hungarian Parliament Building">
          Hungarian Parliament Building
         </a>
         in the bank of the Danube in
         <a href="/wiki/Budapest" title="Budapest">
          Budapest
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/President_of_Hungary" title="President of Hungary">
        President of the Republic
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        köztársasági elnök
       </i>
       ) serves as the
       <a href="/wiki/Head_of_state" title="Head of state">
        head of state
       </a>
       and is elected by the National Assembly every five years. The President is invested primarily with representative responsibilities and powers: receiving foreign heads of state, formally nominating the Prime Minister at the recommendation of the National Assembly, and serving as
       <a href="/wiki/Commander-in-chief" title="Commander-in-chief">
        Commander-in-chief
       </a>
       of the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hungarian_Army" title="Hungarian Army">
        armed forces
       </a>
       . Importantly, the President is also invested with
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Veto_power" title="Veto power">
        veto power
       </a>
       , and may send legislation to the 15-member
       <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_Court_of_Hungary" title="Constitutional Court of Hungary">
        Constitutional Court
       </a>
       for review. The third most-significant governmental position in Hungary is the
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Speakers_of_the_National_Assembly_(Hungary)" title="List of Speakers of the National Assembly (Hungary)">
        Speaker of the National Assembly
       </a>
       , who is elected by the National Assembly and responsible for overseeing the daily sessions of the body.
      </p>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/Debt-to-GDP_ratio" title="Debt-to-GDP ratio">
        debt-to-GDP ratio
       </a>
       of Hungary had its peak in 2011 when it stood at 83% and decreased since then. According to
       <a href="/wiki/Eurostat" title="Eurostat">
        Eurostat
       </a>
       , the
       <a href="/wiki/Government_debt" title="Government debt">
        government gross debt
       </a>
       of Hungary amounts to 25.119 billion HUF or 74.1% of its
       <a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_product" title="Gross domestic product">
        GDP
       </a>
       in 2016.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-126">
        <a href="#cite_note-126">
         [126]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The government achieved a budget deficit 1.9% of the GDP in 2015.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-127">
        <a href="#cite_note-127">
         [127]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Hungary's
       <a href="/wiki/Credit_rating" title="Credit rating">
        credit rating
       </a>
       by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Credit_rating_agencies" title="Credit rating agencies">
        credit rating agencies
       </a>
       <a href="/wiki/Standard_%26_Poor%27s" title="Standard &amp; Poor's">
        Standard &amp; Poor's
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Moody%27s" title="Moody's">
        Moody's
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Fitch_Ratings" title="Fitch Ratings">
        Fitch Ratings
       </a>
       stands at Investment Grade
       <i>
        BBB
       </i>
       with a stable outlook in 2016.
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Political_parties">
        Political parties
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hungary&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: Political parties">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main articles:
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Political_parties_in_Hungary" title="Political parties in Hungary">
        Political parties in Hungary
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Elections_in_Hungary" title="Elections in Hungary">
        Elections in Hungary
       </a>
      </div>
      <table class="infobox vcard" style="width:22em">
       <tr>
        <th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;font-size:125%;font-weight:bold;background-color: #ededed">
         <span class="fn org">
          Current Structure of the National Assembly of Hungary
         </span>
        </th>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;background-color: #ededed">
         Structure
        </th>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th scope="row">
         Seats
        </th>
        <td>
         199
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td colspan="2" style="text-align:center">
         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Hungarian_National_Assembly_2015.svg" title="Current Structure of the National Assembly of Hungary">
          <img alt="Current Structure of the National Assembly of Hungary" data-file-height="185" data-file-width="360" height="128" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Hungarian_National_Assembly_2015.svg/250px-Hungarian_National_Assembly_2015.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Hungarian_National_Assembly_2015.svg/375px-Hungarian_National_Assembly_2015.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Hungarian_National_Assembly_2015.svg/500px-Hungarian_National_Assembly_2015.svg.png 2x" width="250"/>
         </a>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <th scope="row">
         <div style="padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">
          Political groups
         </div>
        </th>
        <td>
         <p>
          <b>
           <a href="/wiki/Third_Orb%C3%A1n_Government" title="Third Orbán Government">
            Government (131)
           </a>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#CC6600; color:black; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Fidesz" title="Fidesz">
            Fidesz
           </a>
           (114)
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#177057; color:white; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Christian_Democratic_People%27s_Party_(Hungary)" title="Christian Democratic People's Party (Hungary)">
            KDNP
           </a>
           (17)
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           <a href="/wiki/Opposition_(politics)" title="Opposition (politics)">
            Opposition (68)
           </a>
          </b>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#FF0000; color:black; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Socialist_Party" title="Hungarian Socialist Party">
            MSZP
           </a>
           (29)
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#000000; color:white; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Jobbik" title="Jobbik">
            Jobbik
           </a>
           (24)
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#639401; color:black; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Politics_Can_Be_Different" title="Politics Can Be Different">
            LMP
           </a>
           (5)
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#0667AC; color:white; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Democratic_Coalition_(Hungary)" title="Democratic Coalition (Hungary)">
            DK
           </a>
           (4)
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#FED500; color:black; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Together_2014" title="Together 2014">
            Együtt
           </a>
           (3)
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#37B34A; color:black; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Dialogue_for_Hungary" title="Dialogue for Hungary">
            PM
           </a>
           (
           <a href="/wiki/T%C3%ADmea_Szab%C3%B3" title="Tímea Szabó">
            1
           </a>
           )
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#43C0F0; color:black; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Liberal_Party" title="Hungarian Liberal Party">
            MLP
           </a>
           (
           <a href="/wiki/G%C3%A1bor_Fodor_(politician)" title="Gábor Fodor (politician)">
            1
           </a>
           )
          </li>
          <li>
           <span style="background-color:#DDDDDD; color:black; border:1px solid darkgray; text-align:center;">
           </span>
           <a href="/wiki/Independent_politician" title="Independent politician">
            Independent
           </a>
           (
           <a href="/wiki/Zolt%C3%A1n_K%C3%A9sz" title="Zoltán Kész">
            1
           </a>
           )
          </li>
         </ul>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <p>
       Since the fall of communism, Hungary has a
       <a href="/wiki/Multi-party_system" title="Multi-party system">
        multi-party system
       </a>
       . The
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_parliamentary_election,_2014" title="Hungarian parliamentary election, 2014">
        last Hungarian parliamentary election
       </a>
       took place on 6 April 2014.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-128">
        <a href="#cite_note-128">
         [128]
        </a>
       </sup>
       This parliamentary election was the 7th since the
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_parliamentary_election,_1990" title="Hungarian parliamentary election, 1990">
        1990 first multi-party election
       </a>
       . The result was a victory for
       <a href="/wiki/Fidesz" title="Fidesz">
        Fidesz
       </a>
       –
       <a href="/wiki/Christian_Democratic_People%27s_Party_(Hungary)" title="Christian Democratic People's Party (Hungary)">
        KDNP
       </a>
       alliance, preserving its two-thirds majority with
       <a href="/wiki/Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n" title="Viktor Orbán">
        Viktor Orbán
       </a>
       remaining Prime Minister.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-129">
        <a href="#cite_note-129">
         [129]
        </a>
       </sup>
       It was the first election according to the new
       <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Hungary" title="Constitution of Hungary">
        Constitution of Hungary
       </a>
       which went into force on 1 January 2012. The new electoral law also entered into force that day. The voters elected 199 MPs instead of previous 386 lawmakers.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-130">
        <a href="#cite_note-130">
         [130]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-131">
        <a href="#cite_note-131">
         [131]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The current political landscape in Hungary is dominated by the conservative
       <a href="/wiki/Fidesz" title="Fidesz">
        Fidesz
       </a>
       , who have a near supermajority, and two medium-sized parties, the left-wing
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Socialist_Party" title="Hungarian Socialist Party">
        Hungarian Socialist Party
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        MSZP
       </i>
       ) and nationalist
       <a href="/wiki/Jobbik" title="Jobbik">
        Jobbik
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       The democratic character of the Hungarian parliament was reestablished with
       <a href="/wiki/Revolutions_of_1989" title="Revolutions of 1989">
        the fall of the Iron Curtain
       </a>
       and the end of communist dictatorship in 1989. Today's parliament is still called
       <i>
        Országgyűlés
       </i>
       just like in royal times, but in order to differentiate between the historical royal diet is referred to as "National Assembly" now. The
       <a href="/wiki/Diet_of_Hungary" title="Diet of Hungary">
        Diet of Hungary
       </a>
       was a legislative institution in the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Hungary_in_the_Middle_Ages" title="Kingdom of Hungary in the Middle Ages">
        medieval kingdom of Hungary
       </a>
       from the 1290s,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-132">
        <a href="#cite_note-132">
         [132]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-133">
        <a href="#cite_note-133">
         [133]
        </a>
       </sup>
       and in its successor states,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Royal_Hungary" title="Royal Hungary">
        Royal Hungary
       </a>
       and the
       <a href="/wiki/Lands_of_the_Crown_of_Saint_Stephen" title="Lands of the Crown of Saint Stephen">
        Habsburg kingdom of Hungary
       </a>
       throughout the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Early_Modern_period" title="Early Modern period">
        Early Modern period
       </a>
       . The articles of the 1790 diet set out that the diet should meet at least once every 3 years, but, since the diet was called by the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Habsburg_monarchy" title="Habsburg monarchy">
        Habsburg monarchy
       </a>
       , this promise was not kept on several occasions thereafter. As a result of the
       <a href="/wiki/Austro-Hungarian_Compromise_of_1867" title="Austro-Hungarian Compromise of 1867">
        Austro-Hungarian Compromise
       </a>
       , it was reconstituted in 1867. The Latin term
       <i>
        Natio Hungarica
       </i>
       ("Hungarian nation") was used to designate the political elite which had participation in the diet, consisting of the
       <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_nobility" title="Hungarian nobility">
        nobility
       </a>
       , the Catholic clergy, and a few enfranchised burghers,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-134">
        <a href="#cite_note-134">
         [134]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-135">
        <a href="#cite_note-135">
         [135]
        </a>
       </sup>
       regardless of language or ethnicity.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-136">
        <a href="#cite_note-136">
         [136]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Law_and_judicial_system">
        Law and judicial system
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hungary&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19" title="Edit section: Law and judicial system">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Law_enforcement_in_Hungary" title="Law enforcement in Hungary">
        Law enforcement in Hungary
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_(15).JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2301" data-file-width="3895" height="130" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e0/Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_%2815%29.JPG/220px-Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_%2815%29.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e0/Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_%2815%29.JPG/330px-Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_%2815%29.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e0/Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_%2815%29.JPG/440px-Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_%2815%29.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Budapest_2015-j%C3%BAnius_13-_(15).JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The original and the future seat of The Curia, the
         <a href="/wiki/Supreme_court" title="Supreme court">
          highest court
         </a>
         in Hungary
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Hungary_police_car_03.JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2394" data-file-width="3659" height="144" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e0/Hungary_police_car_03.JPG/220px-Hungary_police_car_03.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e0/Hungary_police_car_03.JPG/330px-Hungary_police_car_03.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e0/Hungary_police_car_03.JPG/440px-Hungary_police_car_03.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Hungary_police_car_03.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The Hungarian Police (
         <i>
          Rendőrség
         </i>
         ) is the main state
         <a href="/wiki/Law_enforcement_agency" title="Law enforcement agency">
          law enforcement agency
         </a>
         in Hungary
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The judicial system of Hungary is a
       <a href="/wiki/Civil_law_(legal_system)" title="Civil law (legal system)">
        civil law
       </a>
       system divided between
       <a href="/wiki/Court" title="Court">
        courts
       </a>
       with regular civil and criminal jurisdiction and
       <a href="/wiki/Administrative_court" title="Administrative court">
        administrative courts
       </a>
       with jurisdiction over litigation between individuals and the public administration. Hungarian law is codified and based on
       <a href="/wiki/Law_of_Germany" title="Law of Germany">
        German law
       </a>
       and in a wider sense, civil law or
       <a href="/wiki/Roman_law" title="Roman law">
        Roman law
       </a>
       . The court system for civil and criminal jurisdiction consists of local courts (
       <i>
        járásbíróság
       </i>
       ), regional appellate courts (
       <i>
        ítélőtábla
       </i>
       ), and the supreme court (
       <i>
        Kúria
       </i>
       ). Hungary's highest
       <a href="/wiki/Court" title="Court">
        courts
       </a>
       are located in
       <a href="/wiki/Budapest" title="Budapest">
        Budapest
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-137">
        <a href="#cite_note-137">
         [137]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Law enforcement in Hungary is split among the police and Border Guards, and the National Tax and Customs Administration. The Hungarian Police is the main and largest state
       <a href="/wiki/Law_enforcement_agency" title="Law enforcement agency">
        law enforcement agency
       </a>
       in Hungary. It carries nearly all general police duties such as criminal investigation, patrol activity, traffic policing, border control. It is led by the National Police Commissioner under the control of the
       <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Interior_(Hungary)" title="Ministry of Interior (Hungary)">
        Minister of the Interior
       </a>
       . The body is divided into county police departments which are also divided into regional and town police departments. The National Police also have child agencies with nationwide jurisdiction, such as the police force often mocked as the Hungarian
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/FBI" title="FBI">
        FBI
       </a>
       "Nemzeti Nyomozó Iroda" (National Bureau of Investigation), a civilian police force specialised in investigating serious crimes, the gendarmerie-like, militarised "Készenléti Rendőrség" (Operational Police) mainly dealing with riots and often enforcing local police forces. Due to Hungary's accession to the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Schengen_Treaty" title="Schengen Treaty">
        Schengen Treaty
       </a>
       , the Police and Border Guards were merged into a single national corps, with the Border Guards becoming Police Officers. This merger took place in January 2008. The Customs and Excise Authority remained to be subject to the Ministry of Finance under the National Tax and Customs Administration.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-138">
        <a href="#cite_note-138">
         [138]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Administrative_divisions">
        Administrative divisions
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hungary&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20" title="Edit section: Administrative divisions">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Administrative_divisions_of_Hungary" title="Administrative divisions of Hungary">
        Administrative divisions of Hungary
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       Hungary is a
       <a href="/wiki/Unitary_state" title="Unitary state">
        unitary state nation
       </a>
       divided into 19
       <a href="/wiki/Counties_of_Hungary" title="Counties of Hungary">
        states
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        megye
       </i>
       ). In addition, the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Capitals_of_Hungary" title="Capitals of Hungary">
        capital
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        főváros
       </i>
       ),
       <a href="/wiki/Budapest" title="Budapest">
        Budapest
       </a>
       , is an independent entity. The states and the capital are the 20
       <a href="/wiki/Nomenclature_of_Territorial_Units_for_Statistics" title="Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics">
        NUTS
       </a>
       third-level units of Hungary. The states are further subdivided into 174
       <a href="/wiki/Riding_(country_subdivision)" title="Riding (country subdivision)">
        counties
       </a>
       (
       <i>
        járás
       </i>
       ) as of 1 January 2013.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-139">
        <a href="#cite_note-139">
         [139]
        </a>
       </sup>
       There are also 23 towns with county rights (
       <i>
        megyei jogú város
       </i>
       ), sometimes known as "urban counties" in English. The local authorities of these towns have extended powers, but these towns belong to the territory of the respective county instead of being independent territorial units. County councils and municipalities have different roles and separate responsibilities relating to local government. The role of the counties are basically administrative and focus on strategic development, while preschools, public water utilities, garbage disposal, elderly care and rescue services are administered by the municipalities.
      </p>
      <p>
       Since 1996, the counties and City of Budapest have been grouped into 7
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Regions_of_Hungary" title="Regions of Hungary">
        regions
       </a>
       for statistical and development purposes. These seven regions constitute
       <a href="/wiki/Nomenclature_of_Territorial_Units_for_Statistics" title="Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics">
        NUTS
       </a>
       ' second-level units of Hungary. They are
       <a href="/wiki/Central_Hungary" title="Central Hungary">
        Central Hungary
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Central_Transdanubia" title="Central Transdanubia">
        Central Transdanubia
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Northern_Great_Plain" title="Northern Great Plain">
        Northern Great Plain
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Northern_Hungary" title="Northern Hungary">
        Northern Hungary
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Southern_Transdanubia" title="Southern Transdanubia">
        Southern Transdanubia
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Southern_Great_Plain" title="Southern Great Plain">
        Southern Great Plain
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Western_Transdanubia" title="Western Transdanubia">
        Western Transdanubia
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:652px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Townships_(districts)_of_Hungary.png">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1025" data-file-width="1601" height="416" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Townships_%28districts%29_of_Hungary.png/650px-Townships_%28districts%29_of_Hungary.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Townships_%28districts%29_of_Hungary.png/975px-Townships_%28districts%29_of_Hungary.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Townships_%28districts%29_of_Hungary.png/1300px-Townships_%28districts%29_of_Hungary.png 2x" width="650"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Townships_(districts)_of_Hungary.png" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The current 174
         <a href="/wiki/Riding_(country_subdivision)" title="Riding (country subdivision)">
          ridings
         </a>
         (
         <i>
          járás
         </i>
         ) of Hungary
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

       <tr>
        <td>
         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:BlasonHU-nograd.svg">
          <img alt="BlasonHU-nograd.svg" data-file-height="563" data-file-width="512" height="27" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/ba/BlasonHU-nograd.svg/25px-BlasonHU-nograd.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/ba/BlasonHU-nograd.svg/38px-BlasonHU-nograd.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/ba/BlasonHU-nograd.svg/50px-BlasonHU-nograd.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
         </a>
         <a href="/wiki/N%C3%B3gr%C3%A1d_County" title="Nógrád County">
          Nógrád
         </a>
        </td>
        <td>
         <a href="/wiki/Salg%C3%B3tarj%C3%A1n" title="Salgótarján">
          Salgótarján
         </a>
        </td>
        <td>
         201,919
        </td>
        <td>
         <a href="/wiki/Northern_Hungary" title="Northern Hungary">
          Northern Hungary
         </a>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:BlasonHU-pest.svg">
          <img alt="BlasonHU-pest.svg" data-file-height="660" data-file-width="600" height="28" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/db/BlasonHU-pest.svg/25px-BlasonHU-pest.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/db/BlasonHU-pest.svg/38px-BlasonHU-pest.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/db/BlasonHU-pest.svg/50px-BlasonHU-pest.svg.png 2x" width="25"/>
         </a>

         </a>
        </td>

       <tr>
